chat.msg: hey!!! ya comenzamos?
hola
¡hola amigo! aquí estamos en el punto de partida con una ramita a la izquierda que conduce a una isla pequeña con un tigre
what should i do now?
mi espanol no es muy bueno
no hay problema, amigo
which way should i go from the tiger's island?
you should go to el loro
great! so that's southwest past the tiger to the parrot island, right?
spell! i'm at parrot island now with a chatty bird in a tree
¿a dónde me dirijo desde aquí?
from parrot island you should move southeast to frog island
roger that! ok, i'm at frog island
i see a crocodile to the left. do i need to deal with it?
you need to cross the it, yes'
got it, made it past the croc
Ahora que he vuelto a la gran isla de los elefantes, ¿debería ir al oeste, a la jirafa, o de otro modo?
a la jirafa
perfecto! estoy al lado de la jirafa ahora
What is the next step?
head south to the snake
ok, made it to the snake! where to next?
treasure!!!!!
awesome! i'm at the treasure now
Lo logramos *¡terminado!* gracias por tu ayuda

chat.msg: hi there! que comience el juego!!
ok how should i proceed
awesome! so first, take few steps left below that wooden bench in front of you
Ves ese puesto de floristería, ¿verdad? ahora, haz un giro en U a la izquierda y cruza el sendero nuevamente para regresar al perro blanco.
how do i move
simply visualize it this way, buddy
cross that trail you see there, step over the branch and continue heading south. you'll notice another white dog chilling by a red and white checkered picnic mat
done
awesome! now, aim yourself west, stroll over that picnic mat and graze that bowl of berries
¡Sigue yendo hacia donde se pone el sol!

chat.msg: hi there, empezamos?
sure
cool! i'm in a tent at the top of the map
¿Debería dirigirme hacia ese perro sentado junto al fuego?
si
hey, estoy con el perro ahora
Do I continue to the red mushroom or head towards the blue car?
blue car '
arrived at the blue car, ahora, ¿dónde a?
head over to the telescope
sí, llegué al telescopio, ¿ahora hacia dónde?
from there go left and you should arrive at the cabin
alrighty, i see some rocks and
gotcha! here's the wooden house. we're *finished*! thanks for guiding pal!

chat.msg: hey!!! ya comenzamos?
yes
awesome! alright, let's start. from the palms where you are, walk south-west under the first palm
then make a right turn past the second palm, then sharp left before the third one. go south after that
ok
great! now, you'll see a cute little brown puppy
camine hacia la izquierda, luego gire ligeramente a la izquierda y gire a la derecha en dirección sur.
ok
eso es! now, you'll notice a big rock on your left and a small rock on your right
navigate between them, right to the edge of the water!
ok
super! now get your feet wet! head into the water towards a large red crab
Una vez que llegues a él, gira a la derecha y sigue la gran roca. ¡Sigue hacia el oeste en el agua!
ok
perfect! after the third medium-sized rock, you'll see a shark
don't freak out, but make a sharp right turn there
ok
¡eso, amigo! volvamos a tierra
pasa entre la roca mediana y una bola con colores azul, amarillo y blanco y dirígete hacia el norte
ok
you're doing great! now, take a slight left and head to the north-west
you'll see a red tent and a large speaker
ok
¡genial! Navega entre ellos y luego rodea la tienda formando un arco.
ok
sweet! now head south, towards the sea, but stop before you hit the water
you'll see a red kayak
ok
Gira a la derecha y pasa por debajo de ese kayak.
ok
perfect! from there, turn right, follow along the kayak until you reach a small green bush
you made it, champ!

general_survey.answer: I've been living in the US for 14 years
general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
On a day-to-day basis, how likely are you to have a conversation using both your first and second languages?
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At work
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?

general_survey.answer: I find it strange but endearing. Oftentimes people will stick to one language so it's somewhat unique.
general_survey.question: What do you think when others mix languages in conversation? Please explain:

general_survey.answer: I'm definitely more comfortable conversing in English than Spanish.
general_survey.question: Any final comments about your language background?
